intro: Taraxacum tadshicorum, commonly known as the Tadshik Tibetan dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant features a rosette of stiff, hairy leaves and produces a yellow flower head that develops into a white, fluffy seed head. It thrives in rocky and alpine environments, showcasing adaptations to cold and arid conditions. Due to its ecological importance and potential medicinal uses, it is a subject of interest in botanical research.
